snippet: New York’s highest court correctly held that state judges must warn noncitizen defendants that a guilty plea could result in deportation.
abstract: Editorial welcomes New York State Court of Appeals decision requiring judges to warn noncitizen defendants that a guilty plea could lead to their deportation; holds state must go further and enact law that would automatically void pleas in which the defendant has not been warned.
lead_paragraph: New York’s highest court correctly held that state judges must warn noncitizen defendants that a guilty plea could result in deportation.

headline.main: A Judge’s Duty to Warn About Deportation
headline.print_headline: A Judge’s Duty to Warn About Deportation
